key_points: CNN's 'Cuomo Prime Time' experiences its lowest viewership since the beginning of the coronavirus pandemic.
Host Chris Cuomo's ratings drop amid scandals involving his brother, New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo.
Gov. Andrew Cuomo faces accusations of sexual harassment, verbal threats, and covering up nursing home COVID-19 deaths.
'Cuomo Prime Time' averaged 1.31 million viewers the week of March 15, down from its 2020 average of 1.8 million.
The show also performed poorly in the key demographic of adults aged 25-to-54.
CNN's viewership decline occurs as it falls behind Fox News in ratings.
CNN has been criticized for allowing Chris Cuomo to conduct interviews with his brother during the pandemic.
CNN announced Chris Cuomo would no longer cover his brother's scandals, citing a long-standing rule with a previous exception.
CNN executive vice president Allison Gollust has prior connections to Gov. Andrew Cuomo.
Gov. Andrew Cuomo has refused to resign despite the scandals and bipartisan calls for his resignation.
